resources.string:
More updates are coming soon. Please keep sending me your suggestions!
 
 v2.3
 - Updated the UI - cleaner and more simple especially for Android 3.0+
 v2.2.1
 - Added a long-click context menu to alarm list
 - Fixed a crash bug when hitting a key during alarm
 v2.2
 - Added an option in Pro version to cancel alarm if your battery is above a set level.
 - Minor bug fixes. 
 v2.1
 - Fixed sound on some devices including Android 4.1
 - Changed to alarm volume instead of ringer volume
 
 v2.0
 - Added ability to upgrade to Pro to get new features:
 * Advanced settings
 * Multiple alarms
 * Repeat schedule by day
 - All translations have been removed until I get a change to update
 
 v1.1.3
 - Fixed bug that caused the alarm to go off 5 minutes early
 - Fixed bug where vibrate would not always work when selected
 - Fixed a bug with auto-snooze motion detection on some devices (including Galaxy Nexus)
 - Updated notification messages to indicate why alarm was automatically snoozed.
 - Added this change log
 - Updated the Spanish translation using Google Translate Toolkit. Please let me know if the translation is poor.
 
 v1.1.2
 - Fixed a bug where some phones would list Unknown for Alarm Tone instead of just using the default
 - Updated feedback email in menu
 - Removed German due to poor translation
 v1.1.1
 - Fixed compatibility with Galaxy Nexus.
 - Updated developer name to Dr Poindexter
Click notification to dismiss alarm for tonight
Alarm volume is set to zero, press volume keys to adjust.
Schedule alarm repeating schedule, advanced settings, and moreâ€¦

This app will detect if your phone is not charging, not in use, and not moving at bedtime. Then optionally sound and/or vibrate an alert to remind you that your phone needs charged so you do not wake up to a dead phone or low battery in the morning.


Note, the free version does not enable the repeating alarm, so to test it you will need to enable it each day manually until you upgrade to the pro version inside the app. This allows you to see that it works before upgrading.


It works best if you schedule the alarm for your normal bedtime. If you want to schedule an alarm that repeats for more than one day, or a different bedtime for each day of the week you will need to upgrade to the pro version with an in-app purchase. The Pro version also gives access to additional settings.
The Market billing service is not available at this time. You can continue to use this app but you won\'t be able to make purchases.
This app cannot connect to Market. Your version of Market may be out of date. You can continue to use this app but you won\'t be able to make purchases.
Pro upgrade has been refunded. Disabling alarms.
Adding additional alarms requires an upgrade to Always Charged Pro.
Changing the repeat option requires an upgrade to Always Charged Pro
Changing advanced settings requires an upgrade to Always Charged Pro
